title: Ticket #7389: Expose Data Reuse to the ClassAd
description:
The current data reuse code slated for 8.9.5 includes some scaffolding to simply test the data reuse feature - but it's far from what we want.

The existing scaffolding allows us to specify a SHA256 checksum for the executable and allow the shadow to try to invoke data reuse when the checksum is available. What we really want to allow is a data reuse manifest. That is, a file which, when provided by the user, contains a mapping from filename to checksum for reusable files. If specified, all files referenced inside the data reuse manifest should be transferred to the job sandbox using the reuse mechanism.

Example: 

$ cat reuse_manifest.txt
aba8412e2834958e70ca328ee2b9fbf75e6c22670a119903d0f78be56c1baf8e  CMakeCache.txt
0f62f30ce1d39cfe61e5f89aa05d0ef3f62ff597e01d41ba56d150195949cfa0  hello_world2.txt
40ab846d061bff2ad228325eab9918a16155ebf0d373861f48f143b1a085d28d  hello_world.txt
b8bace8e943202fbd0c45f3156010414f6a2f9b0455d8ce094081c331dcb6567  install_manifest.txt

This file would be referenced in the submit description as such: 

+DataReuseManifestSHA256 = "reuse_manifest.txt"

and would cause the startd-side copy of CMakeCache.txt, hello_world2.txt, hello_world.txt, and install_manifest.txt to be reused if they are in the data reuse directory (and the checksum / sizes match).

Note that the reuse mechanism needs both the SHA256 hash and the file size. If it's not provided (and the transfer file is not a URL), then we can use the stat() syscall to determine the size.
